meanings.definition: To change the direction or position of something.
meanings.sent1: She reorients the map to find the correct way.
meanings.sent2: The compass needle reorients itself towards the north.
meanings.sent3: The confused cat reorients itself after spinning in circles.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse reorients ships towards safety in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reorients the students' desks for group work.

meanings.definition: To adjust one's thinking or perspective.
meanings.sent1: He reorients his opinion after hearing new information.
meanings.sent2: Traveling to new places often reorients one's view of the world.
meanings.sent3: The detective reorients his suspect list after finding a new clue.
meanings.sent4: Reading different genres of books can reorient your understanding of literature.
meanings.sent5: The therapy session helps reorient patients towards positive thinking.

meanings.definition: To redirect or change the focus of something.
meanings.sent1: The manager reorients the team's efforts towards a new project.
meanings.sent2: The marketing campaign reorients consumer attention to the latest product.
meanings.sent3: The magician reorients the audience's gaze with a sudden trick.
meanings.sent4: The new policy reorients company goals towards sustainability.
meanings.sent5: The art exhibition reorients visitors' perceptions of modern art.
